posts.text: ä¸€ã€React Components & React Elements & Instancecomponents: è¾“å…¥props,è¾“å‡ºelement Tree. å•ä¸€æ•°æ®æµã€‚123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051// 1ã€ä½œä¸ºfunctionså®šä¹‰const Button = ({children, color}) => ({ type: 'button', props: { className: 'button button-'+color, children: { type: 'b', props: { children: children } } }})// 2ã€ä½¿ç”¨React.createClass()const Button = React.createClass({ render(){ const { children, color } = this.props return { type: 'button', props: { className: 'button button-' + color, children: { type: 'b', props: { children:children } } } } }})//3ã€ä½¿ç”¨ES6çš„classç»§æ‰¿è‡ªReact.Componentclass Button extends React.Component{ render(){ const { children, color } = this.props return { type: 'button', props: { className: 'button button-' + color children: { type: 'b', props: { children: children } } } } }} elements: ä¸€ä¸ªä¸å¯å˜çš„æè¿°å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œå‘Šè¯‰reactè¦ç»˜åˆ¶ä»€ä¹ˆæ ·çš„è§†å›¾ã€‚elementæœ¬è´¨ä¸Šåªæ˜¯æ™®é€šå¯¹è±¡ï¼Œæè¿°äº†component instance å’Œ DOM Nodeï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬è¿™ä¿©è€…æƒ³è¦å¾—åˆ°çš„å±æ€§ã€‚12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940{ type: (string | ReactClass), props: Objectï¼Œ $$typeof: Symbol.for('react.element')}i.e.{ type: 'button', props: { className: 'button button-blue', children: { type: 'b', props: { children: 'ok' } } }}å¾—åˆ°ä»¥ä¸‹ç»“æœ:<button className='button button-blue'> <b> ok </b></button>// 1ã€é€šè¿‡React.createElementåˆ›å»ºReact elementReact.createElement( type, [props], [...children])// 2ã€JSXconst name = 'joeng'const Ele = <div>hello,{name}</div>// æ ¡éªŒæ˜¯å¦æ˜¯React Element React.isValidElement(object) $$typeof : reactç”¨è¿™ä¸ªå±æ€§æ¥å®‰å…¨çš„åŒºåˆ†æ™®é€šçš„å¯¹è±¡ä¸react Elements, è¯¦ç»†å¯å‚è€ƒå®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£: https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/4832 instances: åªæœ‰ç”¨classå£°æ˜çš„React Componentsæ‰æœ‰instanceï¼Œinstanceæ˜¯Reactåˆ›å»ºå’Œç®¡ç†çš„ï¼Œæ¯”èµ·componentså’Œelementsæ¥è¯´ï¼Œinstanceæ˜¾å¾—ä¸æ˜¯é‚£ä¹ˆé‡è¦ã€‚

posts.title: webpack+reactç®€å•ä½¿ç”¨
posts.text: webpack æ­å»º reacté¡¹ç›® ï¼ˆ ç®€æ˜“ç‰ˆï¼‰ webpack : åŠ è½½å™¨ï¼ˆLoadersï¼‰çš„æ¦‚å¿µ pipelineLESSæ–‡ä»¶å…ˆé€šè¿‡less-loadå¤„ç†æˆcssï¼Œç„¶åå†é€šè¿‡css-loaderåŠ è½½æˆcssæ¨¡å—ï¼Œæœ€åç”±style-loaderåŠ è½½å™¨å¯¹å…¶åšæœ€åçš„å¤„ç†ï¼Œä»è€Œè¿è¡Œæ—¶å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡styleæ ‡ç­¾å°†å…¶åº”ç”¨åˆ°æœ€ç»ˆçš„æµè§ˆå™¨ç¯å¢ƒã€‚ webpack is a module bundler for modern JavaScript applications. When webpack processes your application, it recursively builds a dependency graph that includes every module your application needs, then packages all of those modules into a small number of bundles - often only one - to be loaded by the browser. â€‹ â€” https://webpack.js.org/concepts/ webpack.config.js : ä¸»è¦æœ‰ä¸‰éƒ¨åˆ†ç»„æˆ ï¼šentryã€outputã€moduleã€1ã€entry The entry point tells webpack where to start and follows the graph of dependencies to know what to bundle. 1234> module.exports = {> entry: './path/to/my/entry/file.js'> };> > 2ã€output tells webpack how to treat bundled code. 1234567891011> var path = require('path')> module.exports = {> entry: './path/to/my/entry/file.js'> output: {> path: path.resolve(__dirname,'dist'),> filename: '[name].js'> chunkFilename:"[id].chunk.js" //affect output files for on-demand-loaded chunks> publicPath:> }> }> 3ã€Loaders Identify which file or files should be transformed by a certain Loader. (test property) Transform those files so that they can be added to your dependency graph (and eventually your bundle). (use property) webpack treats every file (.css, .html, .scss, .jpg, etc.) as a module. â€‹ 1234567891011121314> var path = require('path')> module.exports = {> entry: './path/to/my/entry/file.js'> output: {> path: path.resolve(__dirname,'dist'),> filename: 'bundle.js'> },> module: {> rules:[> { test: '/\.txt$/', use: 'raw-loader' }> ]> }> }> > â€œHey webpack compiler, when you come across a path that resolves to a â€˜.txtâ€™ file inside of a require()/import statement, use the raw-loader to transform it before you add it to the bundle.â€ â€‹ There are three ways to use loaders in your application: Configuration (recommended): Specify them in your webpack.config.js file. Inline: Specify them explicitly in each import statement. CLI: Specify them within a shell command. 4ã€Plugins 1234567891011121314151617181920212223> const HtmlWebpackPlugin = require('html-webpack-plugin'); //installed via npm> const webpack = require('webpack'); //to access built-in plugins> const path = require('path');> > const config = {> entry: './path/to/my/entry/file.js',> output: {> path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'dist'),> filename: 'my-first-webpack.bundle.js'> },> module: {> rules: [> { test: /\.txt$/, use: 'raw-loader' }> ]> },> plugins: [> new webpack.optimize.UglifyJsPlugin(),> new HtmlWebpackPlugin({template: './src/index.html'})> ]> };> > module.exports = config;> > serve the purpose of doing anything else that a loader cannot do. Function.prototype.apply this method you can pass any function as plugin (this will point to the compiler). You can use this style to inline custom plugins in your configuration. context : The base directory (absolute path!) for resolving the entryoption. If output.pathinfo is set, the included pathinfo is shortened to this directory. (Default : process.cwd()) Other Features of webpack-dev-serverWDS provides functionality beyond what was covered above. There are a couple of relevant fields that you should be aware of: devServer.contentBase - Assuming you donâ€™t generate index.html dynamically and prefer to maintain it yourself in a specific directory, you need to point WDS to it. contentBaseaccepts either a path (e.g., 'build') or an array of paths (e.g., ['build', 'images']). This defaults to the project root. devServer.proxy - If you are using multiple servers, you have to proxy WDS to them. The proxy setting accepts an object of proxy mappings (e.g., { '/api': 'http://localhost:3000/api' }) that resolve matching queries to another server. Proxy settings are disabled by default. devServer.headers - Attach custom headers to your requests here. Enode_modules/.bin/eslint â€”initSince inlining CSS isnâ€™t a good idea for production usage, it makes sense to use ExtractTextPlugin to generate a separate CSS file. You will do this in the next chapter.
